channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I have never been asked for money before’: My friend wants to borrow $1,600 to pay her rent. Do I say yes?
item.description: “I have heard mixed reviews on lending people money.”

item.title: ‘The sky has not fallen — yet’: Is it time to start worrying about a U.S. recession?
item.description: GDP rose by 3% in the second quarter, but the economy added just 73,000 new jobs in July.

item.title: ‘I worked at 14, had an 8.8% mortgage rate and drove used cars’: Did boomers really have it easier than millennials?
item.description: ‘We were frugal, using coupons, discount stores, shopping during the sales and eating leftovers,’ one baby-boomer reader writes.

item.title: Will my spouse automatically inherit my 401(k)?
item.description: “What happens if the participant gets married again, but doesn’t update the beneficiary to be their new spouse? “

item.title: The ‘great wealth transfer’ is coming. Many people will be rich — but they’re not ready.
item.description: Inheriting money is one thing; keeping it is another.

item.title: Nextracker invests in field robotics and AI for solar power plants
item.description: Nextracker has acquired companies to deliver integrated technologies for utility-scale solar power and distributed generation projects. The post Nextr...

item.title: Reindustrialization won’t work without robotics
item.description: Learn why production robotics are essential for scaling automation, improving throughput, and closing the gap between reshoring ambitions and factory ...

item.title: New vision model from Cohere runs on two GPUs, beats top-tier VLMs on visual tasks
item.description: Cohere's Command A Vision can read graphs and PDFs to make enterprise research richer and analyze the documents businesses actually rely on.

item.title: Google releases Olympiad medal-winning Gemini 2.5 ‘Deep Think’ AI publicly — but there’s a catch…
item.description: The Gemini 2.5 Deep Think released to users is not that same competition model, rather, a lower performing but apparently faster version.

item.title: Why open-source AI became an American national priority
item.description: To reflect democratic principles, AI must be built in the open. If the U.S. wants to lead the AI race, it must lead the open-source AI race.

item.title: OpenAI removes ChatGPT feature after private conversations leak to Google search
